text_en: Mental Health Gap Action Programme (mhGAP) guideline for mental, neurological and substance use disorders PSY7. In adults with bipolar disorder (current episode mania), are antipsychotic medicines and mood stabilizers effective and safe? Recommendation (update): 7.1 Oral antipsychotic medicines (namely aripiprazole, haloperidol, olanzapine, paliperidone or quetiapine) or mood stabilizers (namely carbamazepine, lithium, valproic acid [sodium valproate]) should be offered to adults with bipolar disorder (current episode mania), carefully balancing effectiveness, side-effects and individual preference.
